New Records: England could match an all-time national team unbeaten record when they welcome Finland to Wembley in Tuesday's UEFA Nations League showdown.
Pre-Game Insights: England bidding to equal unbeaten Bulgaria record against Finland
Carsley aiming to join exclusive England club in Finland match
Tuesday's fixture will also be a momentous occasion for captain and all-time record goalscorer Harry Kane, who is expected to start on what would be his 100th senior appearance for England.
Post-Match Reflections: England claim at least a point over Finland on Tuesday, they will equal their all-time men's record for the most games against a single country without ever suffering defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England have not been beaten in any of their first 11 meetings with Finland, winning nine of them and playing out two draws.
Others: The Three Lions host their Scandinavian counterparts on the back of making a flying start to life under Lee Carsley, who masterminded a 2-0 win over the Republic of Ireland over the weekend.

Finland were subjected to a 3-0 hammering at the hands of the Greeks in their opening Nations League contest, and the Huuhkajat are still waiting for their first victory over England at the 12th attempt.
